medical_history.chief_complaint: Increasing weakness, malaise, anorexia, and diffuse pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6.5 weeks before admission with increasing fatigue and diffuse weakness, worsening over the weeks, associated with pain in the lower abdomen, constipation, nausea, and decreased urination. One week before admission, the patient had difficulty arising from bed and experienced multiple falls. The day before admission, slurred speech and increasing somnolence were noted.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of diabetes mellitus, heart disease, peripheral vascular disease, renal transplantation, recurrent sternal osteomyelitis, and recent severe hypothyroidism.
medical_history.family_history: Mother had diabetes mellitus and died of throat cancer; father died of prostate cancer.
medical_history.social_history: Retired, lived with wife, drank alcohol in moderation until recent illness, stopped smoking 7 years earlier, and had no history of illicit drug use.
